definition: lit. to draw the bow without shooting the arrow (idiom)/fig. to bluff/to be all talk and no action/false bravado

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
surname Gong
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
arrow/CL:支[zhi1]
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object

lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
has eyes but can't see (idiom); unable or unwilling to see the importance of sth/blind (to sth great)
lit. like stepping on a tiger's tail or spring ice (idiom)/fig. extremely dangerous situation
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
lit. the dog that bites does not show its fangs (idiom)/fig. You can't tell the really dangerous enemy from his external appearance.

definition: flowering autumn grass, fine net (idiom); fig. abundant and exacting punishments prescribed by law
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful

lit. to net birds and dig for rats (idiom); fig. hard pressed for cash/on the verge of bankruptcy
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
